result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron G W Lytle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Defendant to submit DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: May 11, 2016 sentencing after revocation - Court Reporter Marjorie Kurtz

11:40 A.M., Defendant Aaron G W Lytle in court, in custody with attorney Steven Sarbacker.  Brenda Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has received revocation summary, Court sentences defendant to: Ct. 1, 4 years prison, 2 years initial confinement, consecutive to any other sentence if there is one, 2 years extended supervision, 129 days sentence credit, defendant is eligible for Substances Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program, 12:19 P.M.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Aaron G W Lytle in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 18 months probation, conditions: $518 costs, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Court granted 3 days jail credit.

Defendant Aaron G W Lytle in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appearing on warrant, quashed, bond cont'd  Return date scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared for Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requested a warrant.  Warrant authorized but stay until 7/1/15 close of day.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-30-2015 02:45 pm
Atty. Riek requests the July 2nd jury trial be taken off and case be set for an agreed sentencing on the return calendar.
scheduling order
Jury trial on July 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared. Brenda Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant called, is having battery problems due to weather. 9:55 a.m. case recalled, defendant present now. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
